item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, October 31, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenZFS deduplication is good now and you shouldn't use it (218 points | 107 comments)
2. It might be possible to detect gravitons after all (109 points | 39 comments)
3. Chain-of-thought can hurt performance on tasks where thinking makes humans worse (209 points | 93 comments)
4. AI Flame Graphs (210 points | 60 comments)
5. Wonder Animation – Video to 3D Animation (65 points | 6 comments)
6. A comparison of Rust's borrow checker to the one in C# (66 points | 11 comments)
7. Cerebras Trains Llama Models to Leap over GPUs (32 points | 18 comments)
8. Steam games will need to disclose kernel-level anti-cheat on store pages (550 points | 344 comments)
9. Crafting Painterly Shaders (134 points | 4 comments)
10. Google CEO says more than a quarter of the company's new code is created by AI (322 points | 506 comments)
11. SimpleQA (146 points | 41 comments)
12. Do Hard Things Carefully (4 points | discuss)
13. Rocket Cars in Cleveland (6 points | 3 comments)
14. Cooking with black plastic is particularly crucial to avoid (72 points | 60 comments)
15. Pushing the frontiers of audio generation (184 points | 72 comments)
16. Show HN: AI OmniGen – AI Image Generator with Consistent Visuals (115 points | 27 comments)
17. Launch HN: FlyCode (YC S22) – Stop losing revenue due to failed payments (77 points | 56 comments)
18. M4 MacBook Pro (736 points | 1024 comments)
19. The history of Monokai (44 points | 9 comments)
20. An Italian 'fruit detective' who investigates centuries-old paintings (55 points | 9 comments)
21. Show HN: G-win – .gcode parser written in Rust with winnow (27 points | 3 comments)
22. FDA Permits Marketing of Digital Game to Improve Attention in ADHD Children (2020) (22 points | 10 comments)
23. Google's TOS doesn't eliminate a user's Fourth Amendment rights, judge rules [pdf] (293 points | 211 comments)
24. 1BRC Coding Challenge: Nerd Sniping the Java Community (129 points | 34 comments)
25. Rubocop-obsession: RuboCop extension focused on higher-level concepts (68 points | 23 comments)
26. Australia/Lord_Howe is the weirdest timezone (969 points | 398 comments)
27. Generative AI Scripting (157 points | 38 comments)
28. Infisical (YC W23) is hiring full stack engineers (remote or in SF) ( | hide)
29. I attended Google's creator conversation event, and it turned into a funeral (127 points | 36 comments)
30. DeepSeek v2.5 – open-source LLM comparable to GPT-4, but 95% less expensive (145 points | 41 comments)
